definition: to gorge oneself/to pig out
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to eat and drink as much as one likes/to make a pig of oneself
to eat and drink extravagantly/to binge
to gorge oneself with food

sentences.english: We pigged out on potato chips and cookies until our bellies ached.
sentences.chinese: 大吃薯条和曲奇，吃到肚子撑到痛为止。

sentences.english: The boy gorged on turkey on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩耶诞节那天大吃火鸡。

sentences.english: Tom crashed the gate and ate like a horse.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆不请自来，擅自闯进来大吃一餐。

sentences.english: Mr Webster gives me some bread and some meat and I begin to eat hungrily.
sentences.chinese: 魏伯斯先生分给我一些面包和肉，我开始大吃起来。

sentences.english: As soon as the food was put on the table, all the children pitched in without waiting to be invited.
sentences.chinese: 食物一端上桌子，孩子们用不着请便大吃起来。

sentences.english: We pigged out on Chinese food last night.
Mutton string stand someone is holding a mutton string big eat.
sentences.chinese: 羊肉串摊前有的人正在举着羊肉串大吃。

sentences.english: We pig out on pizza and beer.
sentences.chinese: 我们大吃比萨饼，大喝啤酒。

definition: to gobble up/to gorge oneself on (food)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
(onom.) sound of muffled laughter (chuckling, tittering etc)/sound of stammering
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to lose color/to turn pale
to swallow/to take
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to frighten/to scare
can't help it/can't bear it
with great alarm
stunned/amazed
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
frightened/terrified
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to stun/to shock and amaze/stupefied/astonishment
